metadata.Title: CVE-2017-5401 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
A crash triggerable by web content in which an "ErrorResult" referencesunassigned memory due to a logic error. The resulting crash may beexploitable. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 52, Firefox ESR < 45.8,Thunderbird < 52, and Thunderbird < 45.8.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-5401` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 52.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 52.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 52.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 52.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:45.8.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
thunderbird-globalmenu - 1:45.8.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:45.8.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:45.8.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
thunderbird-testsuite - 1:45.8.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:45.8.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:45.8.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:45.8.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '52.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
thunderbird package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:45.8.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
